Open Street Maps

Do you think maps are cool? Do you ever wish that you could edit a map of the world? You can! At this month’s Maptime, we’ll learn about @OpenStreetMaps, a free and editable map of the world (think Google Maps meets Wikipedia). We’ll learn from @Ethan about the @Humanitarian OpenStreetMap Team’s work to respond to humanitarian disasters and then Carl will teach us how to edit the map ourselves. Then we’ll get to work and all edit OSM together! Be sure to follow us on Twitter to find out about future events: @Maptime Madison.

Supplies

Some laptops will be provided, but if you have one you can bring, please do so.

When and Where?

Tuesday December 9th 6pm - 8pm @ Madison Public Library: Central Library

201 W Mifflin St Madison, WI 53703

Join us: Tuesday, Dec 09 2014
